I would recommend that when you make a reservation that you ask for a room that is not facing the freeway as you can hear freeway noise at night. The hotel staff were very welcoming,  helpful and friendly.

Summary: We've visited this hotel two or three times before it was the Volare, and the location is wonderful. The upgrades are absolutely fantastic. We stayed in a suite, so our girls were in a different space with their own tv, etc., and hubs and I were able to watch the sunset and see the ocean in the morning. Even though we didn't have a balcony room this time, I didn't miss it - the view was phenomenal. For the price, it's a treasure. The only knock I have is that the complementary products are extraordinarily fragrant. Don't get me wrong, they smell lovely, but if you are in any way sensitive, which I am, it can be overwhelming. I will mention next time we book. Also, while the new pool furniture is lovely, the pool is older and it would be great if it could be heated in the cooler

Summary Heading: Annual Event at the Voilare - Great Location and Experience
Summary: We have an annual event in October for exchange students and always enjoy our stay there. As one of the organizers I can only attest that all hotel staff is always so accommodating, helpful and friendly towards us. The rooms are spacious, modern and clean with nice size bathrooms. Breakfast is great and plentiful as well. We also use a meeting room and here again everyone at the Volare is very helpful to make our event and stay a great success. Our participants enjoy the pool and outdoor seating areas in front and back of the hotel. It is walking distance from restaurants and shops and a 15minute walk to the beach. We are already planning our 2019 event and truly look forward to be staying at the Volare again.

Breakfast was better than average - coffee was great. Kuerig machine in room, along with a fridge and microwave. Room had a balcony and an ocean view (a rare find). Paid off season rates, but if we had paid high season, I think I might have been disappointed with the quality.

Summary Heading: Great spot for a San Clemente day
Summary: My husband and I went to San Clemente for a quick one day trip. What a perfect spot! If you want somewhere within a couple blocks of the beach, steps away from great dining and shopping this is it! Very casual vibe. We had a west facing room which gave a peek of the Pacific. Will definitely go back!

Summary: My family and I were in town for a music festival and had the privilege of staying at this beautiful hotel. The view was amazing, the staff was very friendly and accommodating, and the room was fantastic! We stayed in the king suite with the Jacuzzi tub, and couldn‚Äôt of been happier.

Summary: Felt right at home from the moment I arrived.  The front desk manager, Katie, was frienly, efficient and gracious.  We were checked-in, parked and in our king suite in minutes.  The location is perfect, suites spacious and great views of San Clemente & Pacfic Ocean.  They offer free parking, free hot breakfast, free WiFi.   Sparkling clean rooms, free coffee in lobby and a small gym & pool.  The best part is that you are within walking distance to area restaurants, bar & shopping.

Summary: This hotel is so clean, the building is well cared for.  The front desk personnel are amazing at making you feel taken care of.  I loved the size of my room and the balcony.  It had decent views as the hotel is located in the downtown city Centre.  Excellent for Walking around this lovely beach town.  The pool area is inviting and private.  The breakfasts are outstanding.  The eggs were my favourite,  I really enjoyed the piano bar for a drink before heading back to our room.  I love this hotel and it‚Äôs in my list of places to stay at again.

We thank you for your compliments regarding our breakfast and our lounge, Through the Looking Glass. We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future! Summary: My family of 5 stayed here Labor Day weekend.    I had called earlier in the week and told Katie that we would arrive past midnight.  Katie said our room would be assigned so no worries.  We arrived at 1am Friday/Saturday.  Upon entry the TV was on to a classical music channel.  The sofabed was already pulled out and ready for sleeping.  Now that's customer service!  Brilliant!  Saturday's breakfast was good.  Disappointed only hash browns and eggs - no bacon or sausage.  I brooded, but Sunday had sausage and eggs, but no hash browns.  I was hoping this hotel would be like Comfort Suites, which has all 3 - and bacon some days.  As usual when staying at a Choice Hotel, I was able to bring food up to the room for my 3 kids since they sleep in.  My wife and I enjoyed dining

We are happy to hear that you would visit us again, and we hope to see you soon!  Sincerely,   Katie O. Front Office Manager The Volare

Summary: Really loved our stop at this hotel while on a road trip. Spent 3 nights here and it was a great hotel in a great little town. Hotel was clean and tidy and very fresh looking. Friendly and helpful staff. Food parking and a very short walk into town with restaurants nearby. There is a little free trolly nearby that will take you to the beach. The hotel offers beach chairs, umbrellas and beach towels for free to take with you for the day. I would highly recommend this hotel and would use again if ever back in the area.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   Thank you for taking the time to give us your comments regarding your recent stay with us. We hope that you will visit San Clemente again in the future!  Sincerely,  Katie O'Donnell Front Office Manager The Volare

Summary: The hotel was clean and convenient. The beach isn‚Äôt right at the hotel door but is a quick 15 minute walk away. It is easy to walk from the hotel to restaurants and stores, including a grocery store. The laundry room is free and a perk I wasn‚Äôt expecting. Dogs are permitted. Breakfast was standard.

Sincerely,  Katie O'Donnell Front Office Manager The Volare

Summary Heading: Pleasant Stay and I Would Return
Summary: This used to be a Holiday Inn so you may see some historic pics/reviews online.  My brother lives in Cali and got married nearby to this hotel hence my recent visit - he did some research in prep' for us guests and commented to me that they are one of the best hotels along the De La Estrella area.  Decent, clean rooms, breakfast is basic & repeated although one day hash browns appeared lol the only hot food was chipolata sausages (quality was ok but had the odd bite of gristle hence not pleasant), scrambled eggs - there isn't the biggest breakie area as on some days guests had to wait for tables or use outdoor/ non breakie table seating areas. Other food, yoghurt, cereals, bananas/apples, prepacked pastires (cinnamon swirls etc), make-your-own pancakes, english breakfast muffins

Summary: I chose this hotel because it had a good room configuration for our party plus the price was fairly good.  My room was actually two rooms.  When you entered there was a smaller room with a a queen bed along with its own mini fridge, bar sink, and desk.  The door closed between it and the main bedroom which had a king bed, a bigger personal fridge and a microwave.  This was the only room with a TV in it.  There were a TON of stations including many HBO options.  I also made sure we were on the ocean view side since it was very quiet.  The lobby is cute and quiet.  The rooms aren't quite as pretty.  Our room had a weird smell.  We ended up buying candles to make it smell better.  My throat started to swell halfway into our 6 night stay.  The swelling went away when we departed for

Summary: Ocean view? I don"t think so. Average hotel at best. Way away from the beach and the water was hardly visible from our balcony ocean view room. Would not recommend to anyone. The staff was friendly but it did not make up for the fact that the exercise room was very small and the hot tub was not working.

Summary: The location is great, within walking distance from downtown San Clemente (and one minute from the ubiquitous Starbucks!)  The hotel itself is an old construction that looks like it's  been refurbished on a shoestring.  The beds, TV, elevator are up to today's standards but things like the AC are outdated.  Ours rattled quite a bit.  The "breakfast room" is actually something to see!  The hotel has kept what appears to be a 1950's gaudy decor with gilded glass candelabras, an old bar with stools, right out of a black and white movie.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   Thank you for your kind words regarding your recent stay with us. Summary: Service at the front desk with Chase was exceptional! He was courteous, helpful, and professional. We appreciate that he helped us with all our needs. Thank you! Great hotel next to lots of shopping and dining, and close to the Main Street that has a farmers market.

Sincerely,  Katie O'Donnell Front Office Manager The Volare

Summary: We stayed one night at the Volare in San Clemente. I have been wanting to try this hotel for some time since it isn't pricey and it seemed to offer a number of nice amenities. Our check in was smooth and we were assigned to a room on the third floor. The room was adequate with a king bed and a small sofa bed. The room also had a balcony with a sea view although the ocean is not that close so the view is nice but not extraordinary. Our room seemed clean but the carpet did have some spots and the door to the balcony looked like hadn't been cleaned in a while. The hotel seems to have undergone a renovation but apparently they are not there yet. There are many improvements that can still be made. I visited the gym and immediately walked out because it is basically a closet with
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback regarding your stay with us. Summary Heading: A VERY Nicely Redone Hotel - Reasonably Priced - Walking Distance to the Beach
Summary: My wife surprised me for Valentines day with an overnight to San Clemente.  The Volare is a resigned and remodeled Holiday Inn, but you'd never know it.  We had a balcony room overlooking the ocean with a gorgeous view of the sunset, and our room was only about $125 for the evening, and that included breakfast the next morning!  It is walking distance to many of the recommended restaurants on Yelp, (review of two elsewhere), and about a 15-20 casual walk down to the beach through the main shopping ave of San Clemente. The walk is further than it looks and all down hill, but worth the walk. It was a $6 Uber ride back (WELL worth it).   At the bottom of the avenue is the San Clement pier and a few other recommeded attractions that we did not have the time to visit on this trip.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback regarding your recent stay with us here at The Volare. We are glad to hear that you were able to enjoy some of the many restaurants located within San Clemente as well. Good choice with the Uber ride back up the hill! We hope that you will visit San Clemente again soon!  Sincerely,  Katie O'Donnell Front Office Manager The Volare

Summary: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel in San Clemente and it was very nice. Spacious rooms with comfortable beds and for the most part very clean. We booked a double queen with a view and a balcony. That's my only complaint, the balcony wasn't worth it. It was incredibly small and you could barely sit out there. The ocean view was nice, but it's pretty far off from the ocean, so you're more looking over the businesses across the street than anything else (however it's much better than looking at highway 5, so book the ocean view). It's also noisy at night (we stayed Thursday and Friday night). I like to sleep with the windows open, and it couldn't happen there. There's a little bar/restaurant across the street that was loud. But, again, way better than looking into highway 5 or

Summary Heading: Feel of luxury with cozy atmosphere
Summary: Location - close to the freeway, close to the beach, many dining options walking distance. From first glance, would not think much of this venue but the lobby was bright and airy. The decorations added a feel of the hotel being something more than something else.  Parking - there were some covered spots on the ground level as well as parking underground. An elevator went to the lower level so it was easy to move luggage up.  Meeting space - we had meetings in the available space. Ceiling was low but there were large windows. However, when the projector was in use, too much light was coming in through the windows and there were no window coverings available. We set up the room classroom style and it was a little tight for our size of almost 50 people but manageable.  Elevator -

Summary: Free breakfast, attentive staff. Room was in great condition. We arrived early for checkin and desk made accommodations to assist us without any fuss.  Location is optimal for town center and restaurants. Only downside is proximity to freeway and freeway noise. For the price was an excellent deal
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   We are very happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us here at The Volare. Thank you for your kind words regarding our staff and your overnight room. Summary: I stayed at The Volare while on vacation for a wedding. The room was actually quite nice and spacious. I had a double room with two queens and had plenty of space for two adults suit cases and bag. Bathroom was clean and large and overall the facilities were good. The location was also pretty solid about a 15-20 minute walk to San Clemente Beach. Dowside are; its pretty much right next to the freeway, I wear earplugs while I sleep so this wasn't a huge issue for me but this is something to be aware of. It didn't effect my stay but please be aware. The parking structure is quite low so if you have an SUV(Yukon XL for me) you might not be able to park there. There is supposedly a pool but I wasn't able to find it and other guest said it wasn't very nice. Overall a great value for
Manager Response: Thank you David for your kind words about our hotel. We're happy to hear you enjoyed your stay and hope to see you again in the future.

They have a free parking hich is very convenient , even though ,one can find parking all aos d the place. Jacob was nice at the reception and they had a free coffee and fresh cold water dispenser right in the lobby as you walk in. I liked their outside inside seating areas where one can take a nice break and a drink.its just three levels, the room was not anything to prag about ,but yet comfortable with a nice bed and a balcony over looking the front of the hotel and a view of the ocean where can see the sunset.  An extra bonus we had, is the breakfast included in our rates, which was good enough, with coffee and juice. The other

Sincerely, Cameron Doan

Summary: I‚Äôve stayed here for years when it was the Holiday Inn - they‚Äôve updated it and its even better than ever!! Location is perfect - restaurants, shopping, juice bars, etc. all within a very short walk!!!
Manager Response: We are so happy to hear that you are continuing to stay with us and that you enjoyed our update. We look  forward to your next stay with us.

Summary: Should you decide to stay here, and you don't want to be TORTURED all night by the ever constant I-5 freeway acoustics you may want to book your reservation directly with the hotel BY PHONE and specify you want an ocean facing room. Well worth the difference.  We booked on the hotels site and for our reward were issued a third top floor room that backs up to the interstate which was also next to the obnoxious stairwell door exit which evidently is widely used as an alternative to the lone-slow as molasses elevator.

Our adult children live in San Clemente so we visit a few times a year. We have always stayed elsewhere  but having read that the Volare was recently remodeled we  decided to give it a try. The place seems brand new. We had a third floor room with a balcony and an ocean view. Even though it is adjacent to I-5, the ocean side is very quiet.The room an the bed was comfortable. The pool area was underwhelming and the continental breakfast was a bit disappointing .But the price was right and the location is wonderful. We have already booked our next stay.

This hotel's rebrand poses as "where luxury meets nature" but we laughed that it was more like where "holiday inn meets the highway."  To be fair, the staff was nice and the pool relaxing (while awkward to access it through the garage and look out onto an exit ramp to I-5). I enjoyed the keurig coffee maker and the mini fridge/ microwave.  We had a suite, the bed was comfy and it was clean -- but it which not laid out well and looked out onto heat pumps and a ditch by the highway. There was a pipe that dripped 24/7 into the tub. The exercise room was hot -- not well ventilated or air conditioned -- one elliptical would not turn on the other made a loud "clunk" on each rotation.  The breakfast was not good, unless you wanted a bagel and cold cereal.   We made the reservation when

I stayed at this hotel a few years ago when it was still the Holiday Inn.  The Volare is nothing like the Holiday Inn was.  Upon arrival, no one offered to help us get our bags upstairs.  There was a free 'breakfast', but the only thing I could eat was what I hoped was a bowl of Cheerios.  I am Celiac's and need to be Gluten Free--the eggs were powdered, the sausage came in frozen circles and the 'cook' didn't know the brand, there was no Gluten Free bread and the coffee ran out in the breakfast room.  The gym only had one 'working' elliptical, and it made a loud bang, bang, noise.  The other one would not even turn on.  There were 2 or 3 other machines that I was not interested in.  There was no disinfectant or paper towels to clean the machines off with when you were done

Summary Heading: Reasonable Hotel Walking Distance to Shopping, Restaurants
Summary: 3 of us shared a 2 bedroom room for a wedding. Used the pool and sun deck. Walked to brunch nearby, instead of the breakfast room at the hotel. Parking was included in our rate. Elevator was very slow.

Summary Heading: Best hotel location in San Clemente - and Free Parking!
Summary: spent a weekend in San Clemente and couldn't find oceanfront so went uphill.  Free parking, we had the very huge and clean Manager's room on the ground floor and it was a full suite that was most convenient to check in and out of. We never used our car and walked everywhere, even to the pier and back.  The town has a free trolley too.  Hotel staff was friendly and helpful and there is a small continental breakfast in the lobby.  Would stay here again!

We stayed here for a wedding. Location was great for the wedding. For some reason I thought this would be much closer to the beach then it was. We did have a nice view of the ocean but it is about a 3/4 mile walk down to the beach --which of course means all uphill on the way back. If you're in any shape it's a fine walk--just not a "few blocks from the beach" kind of hotel. We arrived about 30 minutes before check in and waited in the lobby. Once check in time came around I went back to check on the room and it hadn't been cleaned yet. They did it quickly and we got in our room in 15 minutes. The room was very clean. This is an older hotel that has been renovated. The age shows but the updates are good. Our TV did not work and they weren't able to fix until the next day and we

Some others in our group suggested another hotel that was a lower rating on Tripadvisor so we decided to spend a few dollars more and try the Volare.  We were glad we did. It was very clean, nice parking, nice lobby, nice people, and a very good room. They are not a brand new hotel but evident they have spent some money to keep it up to date and in good shape. You could hear some street noise but I don't think you can avoid that in San Clemente.

My showered not work and the toilet was broken and ran all night. Great staff at check in in a great location. Don't know if I will stay here again at least for the price was not worth it when there are other options for the same price range nearby.

San Clemente is one of my favorite towns and very special to me. Took my teens here for the beach. Hotel has complimentary breakfast which is fine when you are on the go. Within walking distance to shops and restaurants. It is an older property and can use some updating, including the gym. Everyone was helpful. There is a nice sitting area. The pier is just a short drive away. I was married to my kids father at Casa Romantica. It is a museum now and worth the few dollars for a tour and incredible views over the beach. Overall I would recommend this hotel for families or couples who want a clean comfortable room near the beach. The value was excellent.

We stayed at the Volare for a couple nights. Really liked the location but unfortunately we are not planning to ever stay here again due to a very creepy experience. On our 2nd night here, I was unable to sleep due to a very uncomfortable and disturbing sensation in my left ear. An earwig finally came out of my ear in the morning. It really freaked me out! We actually found other bugs on the ceiling and the walls. We notified the front desk. The person we spoke with said that the manager will get in touch with us by phone or email. On our way home, we stopped at an urgent care center to have a doctor check my ear. Guess what? Never heard from the manager. They didn't seem to care.

Hotel is in a excellent location right off the freeway and walking distance to the beach.  Nice small town with great shops.  The hotel is very clean and offers a full breakfast.  There are wonderful areas outside to lounge around and read or have a glass of wine.   Our room and bathroom was good size and it also had a small couch.  The balcony faced the ocean which is a few blocks away.  My only complaint is that the previous occupant must have been a smoker (smoking is allowed downstairs in the lounge area) which made the room unbearable.  I had a constant headache that interrupted my sleep plus the smell of nicotine covered by Fabreze didn't help.  I took medicine but it didn't seem to help.  I would stay again making sure to request a room that was absolutely non smoking.

Based on many of the reviews that I had read about the Volare, I was a bit apprehensive about staying here with my mother in law on a recent visit. We had a room with an ocean view. It was spacious, clean, and quiet. This hotel has been completely renovated and it shows. I can see how some rooms might be noisy since those without an ocean view face the freeway. The pool area, for example, was very noisy. The elevator requires the swipe of a room card to access the guest room floors, offering a sense of safety. There appeared to be plenty of parking. All of the lovely San Clemente downtown shops and restaurants are an easy walk from the Volare. The only real downfall of the Volare, and it isn't much of a problem, is that the breakfast was very monotonous. During busy times, staff

This hotel is almost complete in renovations and is easy access to freeway, pier, outlets, and many restaurants.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  Nice continental breakfast and soon a lounge. You will find the rooms spacious, clean and the bathrooms very user friendly.  I will stay here again when I am in San Clemente.

Summary Heading: Perfect location for Downtown San Clemente
Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights to attend a beach wedding in town.  We were not disappointed by this Hotel.  Clean room, comfortable bed and perfect peace & quiet, in a location with easy walk to Downtown and right off the I5 for access anywhere in the area.  Couldn't really ask for more - other than they also added exceptionally friendly staff, well stocked free breakfast and a view of the sunset out over the ocean in the mix. Will definitely be back to stay if we are in the area again.

Summary Heading: Great Location to the Beach and Freeway
Summary: Hotel has convenient parking and access for I-5.  The rooms are pleasant, comfortable, and clean. If you a lite sleeper, I would suggest not getting a room facing the freeway, unless you like to watch cars speeding by.

Summary Heading: great location to travel the California coast
Summary: We booked the room which had a balcony and whirlpool. It was a very nice room with a view of the ocean. A close walk to restaurants and the San Clemente pier. The staff was friendly and resolved an issue I had very quickly. However if booking do not book the add  on of breakfast. It has a old restaurant in the facility which they give what they call a free breakfast. Normally I don't expect much but  there were no food choices and the area was dirty. I would eat elsewhere. Not what you would expect from a Holiday Inn property. But as far as location I would stay again.  You will have freeway noise if you stay on the side opposite of ocean as Interstate runs behind hotel.

This was a surprisingly quiet hotel, despite its proximity to the interstate. The staff were kind and pleasant, the location was convenient, and the price was right for us. There are many great restaurants within walking distance. I strongly recommend South of Nick's for excellent Mexican food for dinner!

This had to be one of the best hotels I have stayed at, great location close to the beach but away from the crowd..Hotel staff is amazing. I highly recommend this hotel. They have a pool and a continental breakfast. They are also within close distance of a variety of restaurants.

Summary Heading: Great hotel with an even better location
Summary: Wonderful staff, great location, excellent pricing, and comfortable rooms.  You can't ask for much more in Southern California.  This is an excellent hotel. The free WiFi is fast compared to other hotels in the area.  Complimentary breakfast offers a lot of variety and helps to get your day started early.

Stayed here in March 2017 just for 1 night our road trip.It is located in a great spot with just a short walk to shops, bars etc.  We went a bit further down to the pier for dinner.  The staff were fantastic and Todd the manager is a bonus to have at this hotel. We live in Australia but if we were to go back to San Clemente I would definitely be staying at this place.  Thanks for the hospitality.  Thumbs up

I travel to San Clemente most every month for about a week of relaxation. I can only say good things about the Holiday Inn San Clemente. The property is very well kept and being centrally located in downtown San Clemente, everything is within walking distance. The rooms are clean, bright and nicely appointed, as is the entire hotel. You can tell Todd, the general manager, takes great pride in his guests comfort and with his staff, that everyone's stay is enjoyable. I always look forward to my next stay in San Clemente.

Summary Heading: Hotel is great for business needs
Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights for business needs.  The staff was very accommodating and gave me an ocean view room (middle of the week) away from the freeway noise.  The room, with two beds, was very spacious, clean, had a refrigerator and microwave, and a Keurig mini-coffee maker.  The restaurant was under renovation, and the breakfast room had very minimal choices, which would be my only criticism.  But, there is a Starbuck's 1/2 block away, and in the evenings there are many choices of restaurants close by.  Access to the freeway is also very convenient.  Would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Our daughter got married in San Clemente's Casa Romantica.  We selected the Holliday In San Clemente after visiting several local hotels.   The Holiday Inn was extremely accommodating to our wishes.  The rates were very reasonable for the area, the rooms were clean, comfortable and large, and the staff, from Manager Todd to the cleaning staff were easy to deal with and very helpful to everyone.  Continental breakfast was great and more than just coffee and rolls...included eggs and sausage, cereal and juice.  For the morning after the wedding we were provided with our own room for the breakfast.  I would  highly recommend this venue to anyone seeking a nice place to stay in the heart of San Clemente, close to restaurants and less than a mile from San Clemente Pier.

My husband treated me to a surprise weekend getaway on my 60th birthday!   I love the hotel room with a balcony, view of the ocean and a jacuzzi inside the room. The hotel is walking distance to the beach, great places to eat and quaint shops.   Hotel provided free breakfast, parking and has excellent staff.

We were much in need of a peaceful getaway and this hotel did not disappoint. We stay at the crown plaza in ventura often and the room here was bigger and nicer! Plus the people, esp the manager Todd, who went out of his way to assist and make sure our stay was just lovely. Frankly they were the best of any hotel I've ever been to!  However, if you have difficulty walking this hotel might be a bit too strenuous as it is a ways to the pool (which is small), and it's downhill to go most places around town and a big hill to go up on the way back!

The main reason we chose this hotel was due to the fact that it was dog friendly and we could use our reward nights here with IHG. Hotel was clean and we had a really good stay. We looked out to the beach side. It was close enough to go to Disney and Legoland. We really only slept there and was out in the day.

Summary Heading: Great Location, But Not Worth 300 Plus a Night!!
Summary: This is my second stay at this Holiday Inn and I was rather disappointed this time! We stayed during Memorial Day weekend and booked  the King Jacuzzi Suite, during the holiday weekend mark up it was 240 a night, this time it was 305 a night, and it wasn't even a holiday!!! I stuck with my reservation because of the great location, in the heart of San Clemente, just a few steps away from Pizza Port, a must try spot in San Clemente, but next time I will stick to the less expensive Best Western or Travelodge.  Even though I booked the King Jacuzzi Suite again this time, the room was not the same as the one we got a few months ago, for less money. This one was much smaller, and did not contain a wet bar that the previous one had. The balcony was about half the size as well. As if
Manager Response: Dear Adri C,  Thank you for taking the time to leave a review of our property. We strive to provide the best possible experience and it is great to read from our guests on how we are doing. We would like to apologize for the overall dissatisfaction you had experienced during your stay. It is certainly not our intent to inconvenience our valued customers, but to instead provide good value, comfortable, clean and friendly accommodations. Your feedback is of great importance to us and allows us to monitor and improve our service continually.  Although we were not able to exceed or at least be at par with your expectations, we hope you give us a chance to change your perception of our hotel.  Sincerely,  Connie D Case Manager IHGService

Summary Heading: Decent if You Don't Mind Sleeping on a Freeway
Summary: This is an average hotel that works hard to be above average.  My experience was not the best since I was on the second floor with view of the freeway and sound effects to go along.  The room was spacious and clean.  It had many details of an upscale hotel such as separate sitting area, desk, room refrigerator, safe and even room slippers.  The shower was very old and I had to call the front desk to explain how to turn on the valve.  The front desk was very nice and professional and handled check in and check out quickly and pleasantly.  I did not see the pool or rest areas so can not comment there.  I  was told there was a restaurant that closed at 10 pm.  When I ordered breakfast instead, it arrived promptly and I received a 15 minute alert call they were coming up.  The food
Manager Response: Dear Travelinslo,  Thank you for taking a moment to tell us about your experience at our property. We rely on guest feedback as this will allow us to improve wherever possible. I appreciate your kind words towards our hotel staff. It is indeed heartwarming when a valued guest takes the time to acknowledge the passion and effort that our customer service team put every day. I am also glad that you liked your room accommodations. On the other hand, I am sorry for the disappointments you had with the food served and regret the inconvenience the freeway noise may have caused you. Your comments are valued and noted and be rest assured that these will be shared with our management team to help us determine what we could further improve on to be able to deliver a highly satisfactory experience.  Until your next visit, we remain at your service.  Sincerely,  Ingrid V. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: Finding a good hotel that's dog friendly and doesn't charge a crazy fee is tough to do at the beach. This place is now our go-to spot for a San Clemente getaway. Great location- everything in downtown SC is within walking distance, and clean rooms with views and/or balconies are very reasonable. We've stayed here several times and keep coming back!

really nice place! Got some great directions from Chance Mccoy. beautiful area, great staff, next to the beach. what more can you ask for! would reccomend you to stay. great weekend getaway. rooms are clean

I booked this resort just to stay a night with my wife and 2 babies (2 year old and 3 month old) to make the drive shorter to our final destination to San Diego from San Fernando Valley on Sunday night using IHG points.  I was pleasantly surprised by the location of the resort which was a few blocks from a street called Del Mar and the pier.  Del Mar street was awesome and the pier was just awesome.  The resort staff were friendly as well as the guests that stayed there that night.  The resort had a small and cozy feel to it and the laundry room was very nice as it was free and readily accessible.  This resort is definitely not the oceanfront honeymoon resort and i dont think it claims to be, but it is a very nice resort to stay for the night.  It is clean and you will be

Had been curious about this facility, on previous visits to SC. When I arrived, I was given an "ocen view'. complimentary upgrade!. Which really set up whole mood, and general morale up several knotches!   a vert clean an large room. The balcony was over a portion of the main hotel entrance. At night it was very quiet, no noise whatsoever. even with the I5 right up againt the other side of the building.  Nicely built, with the stucco inside the hallway walls. reminded me of other Holiday Inns. Very nice place. Just steps from PCH?El camino and the pier.

Took daughter to San Clemente for her birthday. After checking different hotel decided on Holiday Inn. Glad we did. It was nice easy to find and in a great location. Only down fall I saw was no breakfast included but I am glad that did not change my mind. It is in downtown area off the freeway but does not feel like it is. It is kind of tucked away on a side street off the main drag so easy to get to everywhere. We decided to venture out and walk to the pier. It was about a mile but a really nice walk through the quaint downtown. We stopped for sushi and then for dinner down at the pier. Oyster Bar has a Happy Hour menu and on a cool April night the clam chowder in a bread bowl was perfect. We sat out on the patio  and then walked back up. Stopped at a little bar near hotel and

This was a great pick. Within 1km walk to the beach, the rooms were generous in size and very clean with all the amenities you would expect from Holiday Inn. We stayed here for a wedding and our party took approximately 30 rooms - it was impressive how well they managed to cater for us in the midst of an obviously fully booked hotel. The complimentary car park was good value too. The only negative would be traffic noise at the back of the property (half of the rooms face this way...). If we were to stay again I'd request a beach facing room as it was a little hard to get to sleep with the noise in our room.

Summary Heading: Great service, treated us very well - question over hot water pressure
Summary: Stayed here for my brother's wedding (along with at least 20-30 in our group) and found the staff extremely accomodating as we basically took over half their hotel.  I even rang them shortly before needing to leave for the wedding with a dire need for scissors and the front desk staff ran it straight up for me which was greatly appreciated.  Didn't get a room with a view but spent time in rooms that did have views and they were really stunning.  Also very short walking distance to town as well as 10-15 minutes from beach and pier.  The only downside is that the hot water pressure in the shower was quite weak but everything else was perfect!

Had a great stay in San Clemente.  The staff was very accommodating. They were genuinely concerned that my family and I had a great stay.  I'm a Platinum member and they made sure that I was upgraded to a beach facing room. The room was clean and comfortable. I have to mention Laura, Sheila and Bethany as the super helpful staff. Laura answered all my questions. The hotel is close to the freeway, but rooms are very quiet. Missed having the complimentary breakfast, but the restaurant was convenient none the less. The size of the room is much larger than the HI Express rooms on the north end on town. We liked being closer to the beach too.

We had a fabulous stay, we booked rooms which where at the back of the hotel, but we managed to get moved to the front which are better rooms and have a balcony, which I would recommend,thank you to the staff who moved us with no fuss and where very helpful and friendly, there are some nice bars and restaurants just a couple of minutes walk, the people are so nice ,we also had lunch at the peer, which has great food and views. A great stop over for us.

San Clemente is a beautiful and relaxing town in south Orange County, and there is no better place to stay and visit than Holiday Inn San Clemente.  The staff is attentive and greeted us warmly upon check in.  We were pleasantly surprised to find out we had been upgraded to a suite with jacuzzi and a balcony with ocean view.  Parking was plentiful at the property.  It was steps away from the main street, and within walking distance from the beach and pier area.  The cleaning staff was friendly and courteous.  I had the perfect staycation at this property and would highly recommend this property to anyone who is looking to stay in the area.

I stayed here a week while attending a training session. I had trouble with my credit card at check in. The staff was very patient and accommodating while I worked it out. The rooms are clean and well maintained. Its walking  distance to restaurants, and shopping and nightlife. Its a 15 minute walk to the pier and beach. I will be returning for a family trip someday and we will happily stay here again!

Summary Heading: An amazing hotel and great workers.
Summary: I recently stayed here, and I loved it. It was a beautiful hotel and the employees there were great. One employee in particular that made my stay here so great was Mitch, he did an amazing job and making my stay wonderful. Thank you!
Manager Response: Cody W, Thank you for kind words about our hotel and our staff. We hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: I was apprehensive about the location at first since it was near the freeway; however, we discovered the property to be quiet. The five stars are for how pleasantly surprised we were with the comfort and cleanliness of the hotel in general and the very friendly clerk, Mitch, who directed us to a great local restaurant nearby named La Siesta. We recommend this hotel and the quaint town of San Clemente to others.
Manager Response: Locarte, Thank you so much for your review of our hotel.¬†I am pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay with us.¬†It's something our staff takes great pride in, so we value your feedback. We hope you will visit us again.

Summary: Upon arriving, my family and I were extremely fatigued and in dire need of a nap when we arrived in California. We were greeted kindly and asked if we needed anything else before we walked up into our room. We noticed our room was a bit noisy due to our neighbors on the floor above us. The hotel immediately took the situation into their own hands and moved us into a new room and took care of the noisy guests. We were able to get a great nights rest and the trip was awesome because of it! Love this hotel. I would definitely recommend.

I really enjoyed my stay here and it was thanks to the staff. Laura, who checked me in, was very sweet. Then, i had breakfast and met Iraj who was also very Nice and helpful! I don't go to San Clemente much, but when i do i'll know where to stay.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review of our hotel.¬†I am pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay with us and that Laura and Iraj were helpful.¬†Our customer service something our staff takes great pride in, so we value your feedback. We hope you will visit us again.

Summary Heading: Experience with reservation staff at Hotel
Summary: Tones matter to a customer! "It's Turner" was the response "have a a good day" and slam of the phone. The tone certainly did not indicate I was being wished a good day and Turner did not correct me the first time that I had mistakenly called him Trevor. He however was quick to correct me that his name was Turner when I indicated to him I didn't agree to his reason on why I got a rate different than the corporate rate promised for the reservation I had made. Tones matter to a customer, and it doesn't take much to keep an even tone even if the customer has a different point of view. You can just agree to disagree with the customer and could have been a better customer experience than the one I received. I hope my stay will be better than my phone experience with Turner
Manager Response: Dear SherylPinto,  We appreciate you taking the time to comment about your recent stay at our hotel. We always strive to provide great service to all of our guests, however, on this occasion, we sincerely apologize the lack of customer service received which fell below of your expectations. Your comments are being reviewed by the hotel management, and appropriate actions will be taken to ensure the same situation will not happen again.  Once again, thank you for your feedback and hope this will not deter you from giving us opportunities to make your stay as pleasant as possible.  Sincerely,  Divina P. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary Heading: A good long wedding weekend with extended family
Summary: We had a 4 day stay with extended family at the hotel and found it a pleasant and accommodating place that allowed us to conveniently enjoy events of the wedding, visit each other, and walk easily to many restaurants and shops in downtown San Clemente.  The beach is a bit of a walk (less than a mile but uphill on the return trip) and fun to do.  The hotel provides beach items and we appreciated having those things available without having to pack them.  All the staff was friendly and efficient.  The hotel is immediately adjacent to the freeway and we were on that side, but it is well insulated and the noise was not bothersome.  The waiter/maiter d'/Mr. Everything for the restaurant breakfast, Ira, was helpful and friendly while he accommodated our large  group with a

Normally 99.5% of when I travel I usually stay at a high rise modern hotel. This is my first motel that I've stayed at in 25 years, since I was a child. This was our first trip to California. My husband was in the wedding party of one of his best friends. And he suggested everyone coming from New York stay in this hotel. We were only there for 4 days. The holiday inn was very old but fit into the look of downtown San Clemente perfectly.   We booked a king size bed room and had to pay extra because it was an ocean view room. Huge disappointment in that aspect as the ocean is about 2 miles away and you can only see it on your tippy tippy toes from the balcony. Rep who booked the room for us over the phone said the ocean was less than three quarters of a mile away, however that's
Manager Response: Dear MoonSunSky,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your stay with us. We are pleased to know that you found our rooms to be clean and our bathrooms to be extremely modern. However, we would like to apologize for falling short of your expectations regarding our rooms and for being disturbed by the road noise during visit. We also regret the issues you had with our elevator and parking. We give the utmost importance to our guest comments as they help us improve and continually provide the best guest experience possible. In addition, your feedback has been forwarded to our management for evaluation.  Again, our apologies for the inconvenience and we hope to have another opportunity to provide you a much better experience.  Sincerely,  Joel A Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: This is a great place to go...if you like wasting your money.From the outside,it looks really nice,on the inside,it's another story.The rooms are outdated,and our room was reeking of disinfectant (makes you wonder why).My biggest beef is their so called ocean view rooms.Sure you can see the ocean (over the roof tops of businesses and homes) which is over a mile away,but it is only a sliver of blue,.to me,this is false advertising.They tout the great location of the hotel,but neglect to mention it sits right along the always busy 5 freeway.The pool area is barren and the jacuzzi had green water in it.But don't get me wrong, I'm not bashing the staff,as they are very nice and friendly.It's the hotel it self that I have an issue with.One side of the hotel faces a parking lot and

Very friendly staff- we loved that they had beach items to barrow Nice location to restaurants and shopping and a short drive to the beach I would recommend this to anyone needing a place for a quick beach getaway!

The choices were so limited for San Clemente.  Lobby and elevators were dismal.  Room was clean.  This was a utility hotel.  Nothing at all to compliment... Sorry.  Room overlooked the 5 but thankfully road noise was minimal.  I would not stay here again.  Good location though...
Manager Response: Dear foodiewinee,  Thank you for providing us with a very considerate review and thank you for staying with us. It is nice to know that you have noticed the cleanliness of the room. I apologize that we fell below your expectations on some aspects of your stay. The feedback we receive from our valued guests, like you, enables us to target problem areas and take the necessary actions to ensure similar situations can be avoided in the future. We appreciate the candid feedback we receive and welcome any opportunity to improve.   Sincerely,  Karen G. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary Heading: Great location for visiting San Clemente, close to downtown, but a bit of a walk from the beach
Summary: Don't let the title steer you away,as the walk to the beach is only about 3/4 of a mile. You will be a little disappointed with an Ocean Front view, but as the hotel is next to the highway, it would be quieter to have that view.  The hotel is like any modern Holiday Inn, and the room was nice.  There was breakfast offerings, but they were strictly breakfast bars and a few cold pastries.     If you have a high vehicle, beware, as the parking garage is 7' high.  We were thankful that we took off our Thule rack before we visited.  The main restaurant area of San Clemente starts a block or two away, so it is a very convenient location.  We paid $465 for two weekend nights in July.
Manager Response: Dear mike m,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our hotel. It is disheartening that some aspects of our hotel fell below your expectations. Although I would have preferred you had a better stay, we highly appreciate your kind comments. I am confident that our management will continue to do their best to ensure a wonderful stay for all our valued guests.  Thank you again for your feedback and I do hope that we will have the opportunity to serve you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Faith R Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: My wife and I stayed here for the 4th of July and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. We stayed in the room with the Jacuzzi on the third floor  and it had everything you could ask for in a hotel room. The room was clean and very spacious and all the staff were very generous. Also, the location was great (walking distance to many bars, restaurants, and shopping) and you will never realize that your right next to the I-5 due to the fact that the hotel faces away from the freeway.

Good for the money, Excellent location and parking. Staff was very friendly and helpful. A decent place to hang your hat for a couple of days. I would recommend this hotel and would certainly not mind staying there at another visit.
Manager Response: Dear DannyB1,  I appreciate you taking the time to comment about your recent stay at our hotel. We certainly do our utmost to make your stay comfortable and pleasant, so we are very pleased to read that you were satisfied with the level of service, facilities, and location of the hotel. Your patronage and support to the hotel is very important to us and we look forward to welcoming you back in the near future. If there is anything we can do to make your next stay more comfortable, please do not hesitate to ask the Manager on Duty.  Thank you for staying with us and hope you will continue to choose IHG for your future travel needs.  Sincerely,  Divina P. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: Stayed here for 4 weeks 2 years ago  August/Sept 2013and forgot to write a review. Absolutley fantastic hotel. Great Staff. Rooms are spotless. Food is great too. Guy in the restaurant bar was really nice and made me feel at home every morning for my long stay. 10 minutes walk to the beach. Couldnt ask for a better spot. Hope to go back there someday. Also, I had one minor issue when staying there that the Manager ( Great Guy ) took care of immediately. I cant say enough nice things about my stay here. really loved it.

Summary Heading: Great location for you and your fury companion!
Summary: Great location close to beach and great restaurants! Just stayed overnight and saw many guests with their fury babies and made me miss mine. There are conference rooms available if you need those a  meeting. You can request a room with a view and jacuzzi too!

Our room was surprisingly big. The queen was in the bedroom and the 2nd queen was in a separate room - great for kids. Healthy walk to the beach. Only drawback were some major partiers hangin out  - it was a holiday weekend. And oth, the pain on the halls is so bizarre. The rest is nice but the paint is so ugly.  Loved the waiter at breakfast!
Manager Response: Dear Krisbrake,  Thank you for the candid review. We are delighted to hear you liked your room accommodations and enjoyed the breakfast. We give the utmost importance to our guest comments as they help us improve, and continually provide the best guest experience possible. It is unfortunate the paint in the hallways was not to your liking. We take all feedback seriously and your comments are instrumental for us to improve on what we can offer to achieve complete guest satisfaction.  Again, thank you for your time and for staying with us  Sincerely,  Connie D Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: The hotel is located just off # 5 and it's very easy to find . The staffs are very helpful and nice. Great view on the ocean and within short walking distance from town center. As always in holiday inn rooms are great and the bed is the best.

Summary Heading: You have to meet Iraj the Food and Beverage Director
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel many times over the past few years. Every 3 months we drive or fly down from Canada to see my husband's 97 year old Godmother who lives alone and we worry about. This time we booked with breakfast included and were completely delighted with our daily interactions with Iraj who is not only the F&B director but the morning waiter with a personality that keeps you coming back every morning. The food was delicious the service amazing. Today before we left Iraj gave us his card with all of his phone numbers in case we needed emergency assistance for our dear Helen any day any time....how do you rate that my friends ....we are speechless and grateful beyond words. We will continue to be here every 3 months. The location is great. Third floor ocean view is

Stayed here for two nights as we met up with our Marine for the weekend.  We had a room with two Queen size beds and it also had a pull out couch.  It was a big room and the beds were very comfortable.  The bathroom was large and the entire place was clean and very nice looking. The location of the hotel was fantastic.  We left the car in the hotels parking and were able to walk all through town and down to the beach and pier without feeling like it was a huge hike.  There is a nice size pool and hot tub and while the pool was a tad on the cold side the hot tub was great! The staff was very helpful as well!

Great hotel with clean rooms and comfortable beds. The staff were really helpful and made sure we were happy with our room. The breakfast was a let down as we waited for over an hour on one of the days we were there, the Manager didn't charge us for this day. It is very well situated for the beaches and restaurants in San Clemente which are in walking distance. The hotel has been updated since our last stay three years ago.

Troy was very helpful at check in.  He also helped me at check out as I remembered I left my phone charger plugged in the wall in the room.  He volunteered to run up and get it.  He seemed to be a people person and didnt mind going the extra mile.    The room was spotless with a fridge and microwave.  The balcony was a nice extra to look at sunsets and the ocean.  Dont be fooled by online pics. You do not walk out your room onto sand.  Your ocean view is looking over rooftops but yes you can see the ocean and it was beautiful  There is a restaurant called Maxims.  The California omlette was good.  My favorite was the club sandwich and fries.  The chef Shay makes a mouthwatering club sandwich.  The bartender Diego is friendly and awesome to talk to.  The people at the bar/

We visited this hotel for a short couples getaway and it was perfect. Although it is about a mile away from the pier we decided to walk down and it was well worth the walk. We stayed in the ocean view king room on the 3rd floor and the room was very clean. Our room also had a balcony which was perfect for watching the sunset. Staff was great and friendly would definitely be staying here again.

Summary Heading: Excellent stay at Holiday Inn - San Clemente
Summary: We drove over from Yuma, Az, for a two night stay.   Liked it so much, we stayed a 3rd night... which on Valentine's day weekend was a stretch.   The Hotel worked with us on that request, and the 3rd day was just great.   The hotel staff was friendly, the room and amenities were good and worked well, and the location was great.   We will be back next year.

We just returned home from an overnight stay in San Clemente and the Holiday Inn. We had booked a King/View room and...generally speaking, we were very pleased with our room. It featured a flat screen TV, a comfortable king-sized bed, a sofa, mini-fridge, micro and a balcony. They offer free underground parking.   Check-in was quick and trouble-free. The front desk was nice enough to only charge us for one pet (dog) although we were traveling with two. That was a nice gesture...much appreciated!!!   There is a restaurant within the hotel, which we didn't try. They did offer a Breakfast Special at $2.95. Very basic but it might come in handy if you're in a hurry.   The only negative is the ELEVATOR. It is S-L-O-W... and there is only ONE!! As mentioned, we booked a King/View. I'm

The reservation was made from the Holiday Inn Site and when I reached the property it was not exactly what I was promised or had in mind.  The Night Manager "Edgar Aguilar" went WAY out of his way to fix the reservation and make me and my family comfortable.  I was so impressed with the way this Hotel was managed I will DEFINETLY go back again and recommend this property to anyone.    The Hotel was very clean but the real treasure is the people!

This is a very nice, clean hotel in San Clemente with friendly staff. The room I was in was large and spacious with comfortable beds, sofa, refrigerator, and microwave and nice furniture. Book the ocean view room with balcony that overlooks downtown San Clemente, the ocean, and for the amazing sunsets. The hotel is within walking distance of restaurants, shops and the pier. Only caution: do not eat at Maxim's, the restaurant adjoining the hotel. The food is expensive and inedible. Stay away and try all the other wonderful eateries within walking distance of the hotel.

Couldn't have asked for a better experience. Our stay at the hotel was a last minute decision, luckily the well trained and friendly staff (Katie!) was above and beyond in accommodating our request. The room was spacious, clean and SO QUIET (for being butted up to the interstate!). The life of the city is across the street, making for a spectacular evening. Restaurants of all types are a short walk away. The ocean is just a stones throw away and can be seen from the location. My wife and I look forward to taking the train (from LA) and staying the weekend here.

My wife and I used this hotel for our wedding hotel.  The hotel has just 72 rooms and they were very accommodating to us and our guest who took up almost the whole hotel.  The location is great; as there is everything within walking distance for your guest to make a weekend of it.  The hotel staff was great and helpful with our multiple request.  We were allowed to put signs in the lobby for our event and the shuttle service that was provided.  The rooms are not new but very nice and the ocean view rooms with balconies are spectacular.  There is some noise from the freeway and bars but not to a degree of annoyance.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is staying in or around San Clemente, CA and wants a great value for the prices that they charge.

Love this hotel although not on the water some rooms do have an ocean view. It is located within walkng distance to great restaurants and shops on Main Street if you are up for a one mile walk you can go to the pier . The restaurant The Fisherman on the pier is a great place for seafood. Directly across the street from the hotel is one of my favorite restaurants Tequila's it has exquisite authentic mexican food and is decorated with homie old world mexico feel a little villa and great and friendly owner's .The rooms are decorated nice and are clean with microwave and refrigerator's. We enjoyed our stay here.

Summary Heading: Nice, close to EVERYTHING in OC!
Summary: This is one of the nicer Holiday Inn's.  The location is very close to the freeway, but I didn't hear any noise in the room.  If you are wanting to hit Disneyland, KNOTTS, Legoland, SeaWorld, any Orange County attraction - this location will shave off major time from freeway drive time.    The staff is nice and accommodating, the lobby is nice, and a major bonus - hotel is walking distance from downtown San Clemente and it's city beaches.  Plenty of great restaurants within walking distance too!  If you're interested in keeping costs down you can't go wrong here.  Groupon often has deals for this particular Holiday Inn, make sure to check!!  AAA discounts available too.   If you don't have a car - or have teenage kids, you can't do much better.  Please take time to acknowledge

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, nice staff, walk to eat
Summary: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. So much, that we stayed an extra day. A short 5 min drive to San Clemente Pier. Freeway friendly. You can walk to eat just about anything that suits you. Gavin, at the front desk was friendly and helpful. Parking is easy. Also, my stay was just before Thanksgiving and this hotel was putting together care packages for Marine families. They seem to be plugged into this community. Very cool.

The staff was friendly and we didn't have any problems. They have parking at the entrance as well as in a garage below the hotel, which has a convenient elevator that goes to all floors. The rooms are nice and the beds were comfortable. There are even pillows labeled "hard" and "soft"! I needed to print my boarding pass, and they had a business room for that. However, the computer wasn't turned on and the printer jammed three times before printing what I needed. A simple task ended up taking over 30 minutes! There was a coffee maker in the room, but they only offered powdered creamer in packets. Overall pleasant, but not as impressed as I wanted to be.

Thankfully, I only stayed here one night.  The hotel itself is nice enough and it is in a good location to accessing San Clemente, but it is right next to I5 and there has been little to nothing done during construction to address that fact.  The rooms are nice and spacious and the front desk staff is okay, but maybe a bit disinterested.  I won't be back.
Manager Response: Dear ThatchersBiscuit,  Thank you for the review of our hotel. We just want to assure you that our hotel is very proud of its level of service, cleanliness and quality of its product. We are truly sorry for the noise challenges you experienced during your stay. Though we would prefer you had a better experience at our hotel, we would like to thank you for sharing your thoughts and we hope you give us a chance in the future to show you how great our hotel is.  If there is anything we can do to make your next stay more comfortable, please do not hesitate to ask the Manager on Duty.  Sincerely,  Connie D Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: Very pretty hotel located just off rt5. Convenient to beach and San Clement pier. Nice breakfast with very friendly staff providing everything you need  clean room, nice views. Shopping center at base of hill. A few sit down restaurants nearby.

Excellent staff friendly and welcoming. Felt at home and would love to come back if I was ever in the area. Clean and spacious room! Free bottle waters, has microwave and fridge, plenty of towels. Not a stingy hotel!

This Holiday Inn is perfect for a quick getaway! Customer service was very accommodating to both our late check-in and check-out. My entire family (22 of us) was very please with our weekend together, we were in town from across the country and across the state, for the weekend for our dear grandparents 60th anniversary. Centrally located, restaurant attached, balcony's on most rooms in the front and the desk will lend you beach chairs and towels for the beach.

This hotel stay was not planned... My family and I got stuck in the worst traffic following my participation in a triathlon... My wife and I were both beyond tired and our kids were already out in the car... We deceided to pull off the freeway, and found the Holiday Inn in San Clemente, CA. Everyone from the front desk personnel to Todd the General Manager were friendly, accomidating, and just really nice people! I would recommend this hotel to anyone passing through, or for families looking for a really nice place to stay, and the community seemed really nice as well... We plan to visit again, and will be including San Clemente in our rotation for family trips from here on out! Thank you to the entire staff at the Holiday Inn of San Clemente for your hospitality and overall

Summary Heading: Wow! Much more than I expected!
Summary: I didn't realize Holiday Inn's got so nice! We got upgraded a 2 bedroom suite that was gigantic and had two mini fridges, a microwave, a wet bar, and tons of space! The A/C was ice cold, the TV had full cable and all of the premiums, and the hotel was super clean and felt and looked very new in construction. The staff was incredibly friendly, parking was easy, and it is walking distance to a ton of great restaurants and shopping. Although it's about ~1 mile to the beach, it's a pretty awesome location otherwise - best of all, it's super cheap compared to other hotels in San Clemente. We'll definitely stay here again, we were blown away with the value.

This hotel has great customer service!  I've stayed here twice this year and both times the staff was awesome.  The rooms are clean, decent size, equipped with fridges and microwaves and the beds are comfy.  The hotel is walking distance to a variety of restaurants and bars.  My only complaint is the parking, especially when the hotel is sold out.  The parking spaces are much too tight and when the hotel is full, inconsiderate people just park anywhere even to the point of blocking cars in as opposed to parking on the street.  That said, I would still stay here next time I'm visiting San Clemente.

Great stay overall. The customer service by Cameron was amazing. Cameron was very knowlegable about the surrounding area and because  of him and my experience this will always be my hotel of choice when traveling.

Summary Heading: Another exceptional stay at Holiday Inn San Clemente
Summary: This was my 4th or 5th stay at Holiday Inn San Clemente. Regardless as to who I speak with, I always seem to get excellent assistance and service. Particular this last time, I stopped in unannounced in search for a weekend room. Although they were booked up except 3 rooms, they offered me a room, filtered through there association discounts with me to get me the best rate and were extremely patient. I got a great rate and the room was exceptionally nice, quiet and comfortable.  I travel all over the country for work but anytime I travel southern California, I honestly try to stay at the Holiday Inn San Clemente. It's downtown, close to everything, it's clean, comfortable and reasonably priced. I highly recommend it!

I've stayed at this hotel twice in the last couple of years.  The location is fantastic, short walk down Del Mar to the Pier. You can enjoy restaurants close by. Everything is centrally located to this hotel.  The beds are comfy, the room is spacious and clean...but.... upon entering the room this second time, I noticed an abundance of air freshener that was so strong it almost initiated a gag reflex. I assumed that it would dissipate, but alas, it only got stronger. The smell was strongest in the bathroom.  Upon examination, it seemed like it was being piped in, all night.. Constantly piped in. I tried to pretend it wasn't there, but it kept me awake most of the night.  I wonke up with swollen eyes, which I'm still suffering from and I have asthma as well, and this was a
Manager Response: Jidilbue,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our property. I am glad that you had he opportunity to take advantage of our unique location and visit some of the many great restaurants and bars located nearby.  I also wanted to assure you that we absolutely do not pipe in air freshener. Based on your review we will be retraining the housekeepers on how much air freshener to spray into the rooms when they are being cleaned. Please email me the next time you are planning to visit us and I will make sure that your room does not have an overpowering air freshener smell.

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay outside LA
Summary: I stayed in late September 2014, the weather was great. The hotel is right by the Freeway to Dan Diego but my room was on the quiet coast facing side.  I slept with the window open ( I hate AC noise) and was fine.  I had a view of the sea.  Some nice restaurants and bars nearby at reasonable prices.  Eating on the pier is a must while the sun sets.  The staff are pleasant, the rooms comfortable, all in all a good place to stay.

I have done a fair amount of travelling both at home and overseas and this hotel has the friendliest Reception staff that I have ever come across.  From the minute you stepped into the foyer until departure they were so friendly and helpful.  The hotel rooms were above average and probably in need of a little updating but they were very clean and quiet.  We found everywhere we went in the town they were friendly and welcoming.  Would recommend this hotel to anyone considering a stay in San Clemente.

This hotel has one of the best service I have received in the US. Great location. Nice room. Super fast and very convenient free WiFi all over the hotel. Great breakfast buffet, very comfortable parking. They let me bring my pet. Couldn't ask for more.

The entire front desk staff was very friendly and helpful! Your elevator was not working properly but it was ok also please it's very disgusting when guest dogs are in the pool! But besides those little mishaps definitely will return with my family. ..

Hotel was great. Very comfortable and roomy. Couch went into a bed. Great location and close to everything. Brought my little dog and they had large area with fake grass for pets to do thier thing. Front desk was very pleasant and helpful. I would stay there again

Stayed here because a block of rooms were set aside for a nearby wedding. Read some previous reviews which were not that hopeful. Garish carpeting. We were " upgraded" because of my husband' s premiere status. Our "suite" had the jacuzzi tub right next to the bed with mirrors! We were apparently given a room w/ an ocean view, but you really could not see the ocean very well. We were told by other guests that we were lucky to be at the rear of the property as the the rooms close to the highway were noisy with traffic noise and difficult to sleep. One plus-- the rooms were clean
Manager Response: Louise J,  I regret to hear that you that your stay was less than you had hoped it would be. Please consider staying with us in the future and I will make sure that you get a room that is better suited to your liking.

Summary: Stayed in San clemente overnight to be close to Dana point for a whale cruise... Location was wonderful. Beautiful ocean view. Hotel staff very nice, parking easy. Rooms comfortable. Only downside for our family is 1. No vending machine for a quick snack late 2. The club across the street plays their music really loud on Saturday nights (not the hotels fault obviously but a little annoying) but lovely hotel. I would certainly stay again and recommend!

The Holiday Inn is a very clean and well kept hotel. It is close to the ocean. Restaurants and shops are within walking distance. The rooms are spacious and clean, with very comfortable beds. The staff is very hospitable and accommodating. Todd & Troy go out of their way to make sure we have a pleasant stay. During the 1st week of July, we had excellent weather with a nice cool breeze throughout the day. We really enjoyed the 4th of July fireworks.

Summary Heading: This could have been a great stay.
Summary: 1. This was a working vacation and i needed in room internet service. I was unable to connect the first night and talked to Todd the Manager the next morning, Todd tried hard to help that morning and we were able to get a connection with 2 bars. However, as soon as Todd left the connection failed and the network didn't even show as a possible connection. I left a message for Todd to call me and he never returned my call, that was on 6-18 as of today 6-23 i still haven't heard from him. 2. the dining experience was excellent, especially by the manager (Inaja? who's name i can't remember how to spell), but he was from Persia. he couldn't do enough for you. good food, great service and a fun experience. that was over the weekend. on Monday i received a nice greeting when i entered
Manager Response: Thank you for your reviews on Tripadvisor and Yelp. We appreciate your comments and are working   diligently to resolve the unfortunate issues you had to endure while being our guest. As you and I   discussed during your stay, we are currently in the process of working with Cox Communication in order   to have the strongest and most reliable internet in Orange County. As I am sure you noticed the Cox   Communication trucks on property, we are close to completion.   Sincerely,  Todd Forester

Summary Heading: The worst hotel I have ever stayed in.
Summary: I booked two rooms for a family wedding in the area.  First off the only elevator was under repair.  My father asked for a first floor room due to heart lung condition.  He was told they only had top floor and he would have to walk the stairs.    The rooms were dirty and smelled of cigarettes even though they were supposedly non smoking.  I called Holiday Inn corporate to tell what a disgrace to their name this hotel is.  Should be a reclamation project.  Never again.

This hotel has large, updated comfortable rooms. We stayed in a ocean side room and its not ocean front but can you see the ocean. The rate was great through groupon. Its clean the front staff is very friendly,parking was not an issue. Will stay here again for sure.
Manager Response: MTgirl5517, Thank you for taking the time to review our property. I am thrilled that you had a great time at our hotel and we look forward to seeing you again in the future.

Summary: My family and I travel here a few times a year for a beach getaway.  Very nice location and walking distance to shops and places to eat.  The accommodations are nice, but nothing fancy.  Quick drive to the beach and downtown area for more shopping.

Summary Heading: Grateful for excellent service & comfortable stay
Summary: Thank you to Todd, Shane and all the excellent staff at this location for another beautiful stay in San Clemente. Having first experienced the great location & care of the staff in January during a business trip, I was thrilled to be welcomed back for a visit with my Grandmother for a trip celebrating her 80th birthday. The rooms are spacious, very clean and quite comfortable. We loved being able to peek at the ocean on the horizon.   The sunset from our ocean-facing balcony was stunning!

With a last minute booking during memorial weekend, Troy and staff were very friendly, helpful and accommodating. The hotel, as well as the room, was very clean and well maintained. I loved the balcony with the great view and  can't forget to mention that the bed was very comfortable. They have a great breakfast buffet that goes on until 10 am also. The hotel is conveniently located close to the beach, pier, restaurants, shops and bars. Such an enjoyable walk to the pier. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will be staying here again. Thank you for the great hospitality!!
Manager Response: anafue17,  Thank you for the your comments about our hotel. I am thrilled that you had such a great experience at the Holiday Inn, San Clemente and we hope to see you again soon.

Summary: San Clement is a great town to relax and enjoy beautiful weather by the beach. This Holiday Inn reflects all that and more! The location is great and the staff is even better. My significant other and I stayed in this great hotel for the weekend of Memorial day 2014, we had a blast! We walked down to the pier, we had a awesome dinner in one of the many restaurants near by and went  out for some drinks in one of the many though unique bars around the area. I highly recommend this Holiday Inn to anyone staying in San Clemente!
Manager Response: Dj_vz,  Thank you for taking the time to review the Holiday Inn, San Clemente. I always love to hear about our guests experiences when they take full advantage of our unique location in beautiful San Clemente. We hope to see you again in the near future.

Summary: My husband and I love coming here. It is in the perfect location, walking distance to all the bars and restaurants. The rooms are ok, I suggest upgrading to the 3rd floor. Jet tub and balcony with ocean view, can't beat that! The front desk crew are always inviting and helpful.

We recently stayed at this property for my nephew's wedding and coincidentally had a travel ball tournament nearby.  We had a "suite" but it is not your typical suite offerings you would expect from other hotels.  You enter the room, bed to the left, two sofa chairs to the right, and in the back is the second bed.  The bathroom is in the middle (similar to Jack and Jill setup).  The interior is dated, the bathroom is cramped and there's an A/C condensation drain right above the shower head...site for sore eyes.  The worst is the one elevator on premise.  It was painfully slow as we had luggage haul up. If you are looking to make a bee line out the door after you've checked in, it is better to take the stairs at either end.  Breakfast not included.  They offered coffee in the AM.
Manager Response: Dear BBallDad88,  Thank you for staying and for taking the time to post a review regarding your recent stay. I regret to learn that our room layout and elevator were not up to your standards. I apologize for any inconvenience these may have caused you. We value all your feedback, whether negative or positive, for this will help us target specific concerns and make the appropriate upgrades towards improving our facility.  Once again, thank you for staying with us and I hope we have the chance to hosting you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Faith R Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: What a great Hotel.  Friendly staff, beautiful view, easy parking, spacious room.  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend staying there.  Thank you Todd Forrester for your excellent service and your hotel is wonderful.
Manager Response: Alison T, Thank you for you wonderful review. I am pleased that you had a great time while staying with us and we hope to see you again this summer!

Summary: The people at the front desk, Troy and Austin, were wonderful!  A hold had been placed on my credit card because they didn't know that I was in California.  They assisted me and trusted me.  This could have ruined my vacation, but they were understanding and incredibly nice to me.  I come to San  Clemente 2 or 3 times a year and will always stay here.  Thank you!

My wife & I stayed @ this hotel from Thursday until Sunday. Upon arrival we were directed to our room. The room was nice & clean. BUT NO OCEAN VIEW!! We had an ocean view room on the 2nd floor. BUT the ocean was hardly visible. We had A major issue We couldn't sleep despite the fact that we were dead tired! The people in the room above us were so loud & inconsiderate. Now it is little before 5am. I finally decided to check the 3rd floor to find out if it Was a utility room or what. I realized that it was a hotel guest room! Buy 6:30-7:00 am I went to the front desk to get some coffee & explain the situation to the staff member. The manager Todd was very NICE. He apologized right away & offered to give us a room on the 3rd floor with ocean view. Now the view of the ocean was

Our roundtrip starts here and already regretting that it does not end here as well. Especially the town itself is just too lovely and easy-going (perfect to unwind), and the hotel is pretty nice too. Its location is perfect, near highway exits and a good walk from the beach (although it's a climb back!).
